intro: Windmannia glabra, commonly known as the smooth windmannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its smooth, glabrous stems and foliage are distinctive features. Windmannia glabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral displays.
